result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryce E. Shafranski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

Full compliance with all conditions of DEOJ.  DNA sample.

Case Called: 3:34 pm
INCLUDES 14CF1046 & 15CF748.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Molly Lawrence. Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Travis Slattery.
Parties state that there are no corrections to be made to the PSI.
Atty Slattery states that they have filed an Alternative PSI and Letters prior to Sentencing Hearing.
Court to review the PSI and Letters off the record before proceeding.

BOTR- 3:48 PM
Court has reviewed all documents. 
State makes sentencing arguments.
Defense makes sentencing arguments.
OTR- 4:17 PM
BOTR- 4:19 PM
Defendant makes statement.
Court has been provided with Defendant's Letter Statement.
Court addresses the Defendant.

COURT ORDERS:
14CF1046:
Ct. 1 (3rd Degree Sexual Assault)>> 10 Years WSPS, 5 Years IC and 5 Years ES, Concurrent to 15CF748. CONDITIONS: No contact with the victims or victim's family listed in this case, Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Display a good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, Pay all court ordered obligations, restitution as ordered (Restitution Ordered from Probation previously is to be paid while on ES), supervision fees and any other fees/fines/debts, Participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs as directed by agent or the court, Complete a Sex Offender Assessment and follow any recommendations for treatment and programming, Register with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program as required by law. Defendant is not eligible for programming. Court finds 745 Days Credit.

15CF748:
Ct. 3 (BJ-Felony-Repeater)>> 6 Years WSPS, 3 Years IC and 3 Years ES, Concurrent to 14CF1046 and Concurrent to Ct. 4 & Ct. 5 in 15CF748. CONDITIONS: No contact with the victims or victim's family listed in this case, Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Display a good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, Pay all court ordered obligations, restitution as ordered (Restitution Ordered from Probation previously is to be paid while on ES), supervision fees and any other fees/fines/debts, Participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs as directed by agent or the court, Complete a Sex Offender Assessment and follow any recommendations for treatment and programming, Register with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program as required by law. Defendant is not eligible for programming. Court finds 648 Days Credit.

Ct. 4 (Resisting or Obstructing an Officer-Repeater)>> 9 Months MCJ, Concurrent to Ct. 3 & Ct. 5 in 15CF748. CONDITIONS: No contact with the victims or victim's family listed in this case, Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Display a good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, Pay all court ordered obligations, restitution as ordered (Restitution Ordered from Probation previously is to be paid while on ES), supervision fees and any other fees/fines/debts, Participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs as directed by agent or the court, Complete a Sex Offender Assessment and follow any recommendations for treatment and programming, Register with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program as required by law. Defendant is not eligible for programming. Court finds 648 Days Credit.

Ct. 5 (DC-Repeater)>> 9 Months MCJ, Concurrent to Ct. 3 & Ct. 4 in 15CF748. CONDITIONS: No contact with the victims or victim's family listed in this case, Maintain absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol, Display a good faith effort to maintain fulltime employment, schooling, or combination of the two, Pay all court ordered obligations, restitution as ordered (Restitution Ordered from Probation previously is to be paid while on ES), supervision fees and any other fees/fines/debts, Participate in and successfully complete any assessments, evaluations, and/or treatment programs as directed by agent or the court, Complete a Sex Offender Assessment and follow any recommendations for treatment and programming, Register with the Wisconsin Sex Offender Registry Program as required by law. Defendant is not eligible for programming. Court finds 648 Days Credit.

State appears by DDA Theresa Wetzsteon; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Thomas Wilmouth. 

State to file amended information before close of business TODAY.

State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Child Abuse/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 2 (Child Abuse/PTAC/Repeater)>>D&RI.

PLEA: Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 4 (Obstructing an Officer/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 
         : Ct. 5 (DC/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, guilty on Cts. 4 & 5, and defers entry of judgment Ct. 3. 

COURT ORDERS: 
On Ct. 3>>DEOJ for 3 years with conditions as outlined in written agreement. 
On Cts. 4 & 5>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONDITIONS: full complaince with all conditions of deferred entry of judgment; misd. DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 

COURT finds the def entitled to 242 days jail credit if revoked. 
COURT orders all sentences to run CONCURRENT including sentence in 14CF1046. 
COURT does NOT find def eligible to petition for expungement. 
State notes if def successfully completes DEOJ, it will move to amend charge to Misd. BJ with no additional penalties/costs. 
Review of DEOJ set for 8/16/2019 at 10:45 am in Br. 3.
